data.title: EWTN Catholic TV Program Schedule
data.meta_description: EWTN is a global, Catholic Television, Catholic Radio, and Catholic News Network that provides catholic programming and news coverage from around the world.
data.text:
The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Personal change can happen but it takes more than determination. To experience significant lasting change, we must cooperate with grace. Thankfully, God is always there to help us.

(30 minutes)

With abortion front and center in the race for the White House, Vice President Kamala Harris has picked pro-abortion governor Tim Walz as her running mate. We look at both their track records. Live Action’s Lila Rose weighs in on this year’s presidential candidates and the implications this election could have on the pro-life movement. Concerning new studies indicate a rise in abortion and alarming methods some women use to abort their babies. A new heartbeat law takes effect in the Midwest.

(30 minutes)

In what was seen as a surprise pick to many, Pope Francis appoints Providence’s Bishop Richard Henning as the next archbishop of Boston – we speak one-on-one with Archbishop-elect Henning about what he’s looking forward to in his next assignment. Mark Irons examines where both U.S. vice presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance stand on the life issue and other topics critical to Catholic voters. In light of JD Vance’s resurfaced comments on childlessness, we take a deep dive into what’s behind the lower marital and fertility rates today with Communio president J.P. De Gance and Catholic writer Emily Stimpson Chapman. And Colm Flynn takes us inside the kitchen of Fr. Leo Patalinghug’s food ministry.

(60 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

The life of St. Peter is the backdrop for this exploration of the rich history and beauty of Vatican City. Fr. Leo provides a closer look at the Holy See and our first pope, the saint upon which Jesus built his Church.

(30 minutes)

Anthony DeStefano wraps things up by discussing three of the hardest realities in life to understand: the presence of evil in the world, suffering, the meaning of love and its greatest symbol, the Cross.

(30 minutes)

Christ asks us to give ourselves over to God. Fr. Benedict discusses the Meaning of Personal Conversion and why we must die to ourselves to gain eternal life.

(30 minutes)

Three great books by two Catholic converts are on tap in today’s episode. Joseph Pearce looks at Robert Hugh Benson’s “By What Authority?” and “Lord of the World” and G.K. Chesterton's “The Man Who Was Thursday.”

(30 minutes)

Saint Dominic provides an enlighted view on Catherism, a popular heresy that he preached zealously against. But when Simone de Beauvoir shows up with ideas of female freedom, contraception and abortion, the sparks fly.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Similar to how ancient civilizations often used myths to explain the world, Dr. Kreeft and Dr. Howard examine how the writings of CS Lewis and JRR Tolkien can help us obtain a better understanding of God and the world He created.

(30 minutes)

There’s no pain like the loss of a child, and Danny and Leila Abdallah lost three of them to a drunk driver. They speak about the aspects of forgiveness and how it’s blessed them.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Diagnosed with ALS, the outloook for Christine Marro was bleak. But a visit to Lourdes during the 150th anniversary of Our Lady’s first appearance changed Chrissy’s life. Hear the true story of her miraculous healing.

(30 minutes)

Christ is person-specific in His "Search and Rescue" Mission. The message of Truth and Love is for everyone. Even if our efforts are modest and simple they are valuable in God's eyes.

(30 minutes)

Three great books by two Catholic converts are on tap in today’s episode. Joseph Pearce looks at Robert Hugh Benson’s “By What Authority?” and “Lord of the World” and G.K. Chesterton's “The Man Who Was Thursday.”

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Joyful Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(20 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word as they recite this beautiful prayer in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(10 minutes)

Fr. Chris explains a “soul tie,” how they work, and the five steps for breaking bad "soul ties" with the help of a priest. We also hear a redemptive story from Andrew Comiskey.

(30 minutes)

Christ asks us to give ourselves over to God. Fr. Benedict discusses the Meaning of Personal Conversion and why we must die to ourselves to gain eternal life.

(30 minutes)

Floral designer and author, Emily Malloy, shares how flowers point to our innate need for beauty, and in what ways flowers lift our minds to all that is good, true, and beautiful.

(30 minutes)

A silly argument between Renata, Leopold and Tim prompts Fr. John to share the Parable of the Foolish Virgins. Essential love is needed to be with Jesus in heaven, so the children must prepare their hearts to meet Him.

(30 minutes)

Nicaragua's vice president, the wife of Daniel Ortega, announced that 7 priests left the country. On Sunday, the first victim of the violence in the UK was laid to rest at St. Patrick's Catholic Church. And as the 2024 Paris Olympics have officially come to a close, we look back at their legacy.

(30 minutes)

Nicaragua's vice president, the wife of Daniel Ortega, announced that 7 priests left the country. On Sunday, the first victim of the violence in the UK was laid to rest at St. Patrick's Catholic Church. And as the 2024 Paris Olympics have officially come to a close, we look back at their legacy.

(30 minutes)

Floral designer and author, Emily Malloy, shares how flowers point to our innate need for beauty, and in what ways flowers lift our minds to all that is good, true, and beautiful.

(30 minutes)

Nicaragua's vice president, the wife of Daniel Ortega, announced that 7 priests left the country. On Sunday, the first victim of the violence in the UK was laid to rest at St. Patrick's Catholic Church. And as the 2024 Paris Olympics have officially come to a close, we look back at their legacy.

(30 minutes)

Dr. Hahn and Mike discuss how to help non-Catholics understand Catholic devotion to Mary is not goddess worship, but honoring her as God's most exalted creature because of the grace of Her Son.

(30 minutes)

Similar to how ancient civilizations often used myths to explain the world, Dr. Kreeft and Dr. Howard examine how the writings of CS Lewis and JRR Tolkien can help us obtain a better understanding of God and the world He created.

(30 minutes)

Young university students who volunteered with the Missionaries of the Poor explain how selfish concerns can blind us to people who need our help, love and presence.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Sorrowful Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(19 minutes)

Destined for a political career, St. Ambrose of Milan instead made serving God his life’s mission. As one of our greatest bishops, he defended the authentic teachings of the Church and opened up Scripture to the masses.

(30 minutes)

Frances Hogan shares the divine nature of Jesus as Messiah, King and Lord. As the God-Man, Jesus fulfills all scriptural prophecies in a way no one could have expected or completely comprehend.

(30 minutes)

Emily Malloy returns to unfold the flower as a bridge that not only brings home and garden together, but also unites the eternal to the everyday. Learn more about floral arranging.

(30 minutes)

With abortion front and center in the race for the White House, Vice President Kamala Harris has picked pro-abortion governor Tim Walz as her running mate. We look at both their track records. Live Action’s Lila Rose weighs in on this year’s presidential candidates and the implications this election could have on the pro-life movement. Concerning new studies indicate a rise in abortion and alarming methods some women use to abort their babies. A new heartbeat law takes effect in the Midwest.

(30 minutes)

Too many fear death without understanding it’s a gateway to eternal life. Ralph and Peter talk about the necessity of considering our death and preparing well to meet the Lord.

(30 minutes)

From humble beginnings as the son of Irish immigrants to his founding of the Knights of Columbus, Father McGivney’s life was an inspiring example of fraternal charity, evangelization and empowerment of the laity.

(30 minutes)

The US has bolstered its military presence in the Middle East. A new report reveals continued gang violence in Haiti despite new leadership and an influx of international security forces. And there's still a couple weeks left to see one of the most anticipated meteor showers of the year.

(30 minutes)

There’s no pain like the loss of a child, and Danny and Leila Abdallah lost three of them to a drunk driver. They speak about the aspects of forgiveness and how it’s blessed them.

(30 minutes)

The US has bolstered its military presence in the Middle East. A new report reveals continued gang violence in Haiti despite new leadership and an influx of international security forces. And there's still a couple weeks left to see one of the most anticipated meteor showers of the year.

(30 minutes)

Emily Malloy returns to unfold the flower as a bridge that not only brings home and garden together, but also unites the eternal to the everyday. Learn more about floral arranging.

(30 minutes)

The US has bolstered its military presence in the Middle East. A new report reveals continued gang violence in Haiti despite new leadership and an influx of international security forces. And there's still a couple weeks left to see one of the most anticipated meteor showers of the year.

(30 minutes)

From humble beginnings as the son of Irish immigrants to his founding of the Knights of Columbus, Father McGivney’s life was an inspiring example of fraternal charity, evangelization and empowerment of the laity.

(30 minutes)

When one of his sisters asked Saint Thomas Aquinas what does a person have to do to become a saint, he gave her a brilliant answer with only two words. Learn the genius of his response in today’s gospel glimpse.

(15 minutes)

Based on the Miracle of the Loaves and the Fishes, Father Leo Clifford explains how one person can truly impact many. We each have our own mission and each person is unique. If we do not accomplish our mission, it goes undone.

(15 minutes)

Michael O'Neill investigates the supernatural experiences of Benedicta Rencurel. In 1664, the Virgin Mary gave her messages about prayer for the conversion of sinners, and visited her throughout the rest of her life.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Glorious Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(18 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word as they recite this inspirational litany asking for the prayers of Saint Joseph from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(12 minutes)

Fr. Spitzer and Doug discuss how in order to continue our personal conversion, we must recognize that God does not stand aloof but is personally and actively involved in our lives.

(60 minutes)

The Trump campaign says Iran is behind the recent hack that led to sensitive internal documents being stolen & distributed. Ernesto is now a hurricane and is expected to grow stronger on its path towards Bermuda. And a look at the Assumption of Mary depicted in art throughout history.

(30 minutes)

The Trump campaign says Iran is behind the recent hack that led to sensitive internal documents being stolen & distributed. Ernesto is now a hurricane and is expected to grow stronger on its path towards Bermuda. And a look at the Assumption of Mary depicted in art throughout history.

(30 minutes)

From the Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes in Lourdes, France, don’t miss this moving candlelight procession for Mary on the Feast of the Assumption of the Blessed Mother into heaven.

(90 minutes)

Fr. Spitzer and Doug discuss how in order to continue our personal conversion, we must recognize that God does not stand aloof but is personally and actively involved in our lives.

(60 minutes)

The Trump campaign says Iran is behind the recent hack that led to sensitive internal documents being stolen & distributed. Ernesto is now a hurricane and is expected to grow stronger on its path towards Bermuda. And a look at the Assumption of Mary depicted in art throughout history.

(30 minutes)

This International Mass brings pilgrims from around the world together to celebrate the Feast of the Assumption at the Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes in Lourdes, France.

(120 minutes)

Saint Dominic provides an enlighted view on Catherism, a popular heresy that he preached zealously against. But when Simone de Beauvoir shows up with ideas of female freedom, contraception and abortion, the sparks fly.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama, as they recite this beautiful prayer in honor of the Precious Blood of Jesus shed for our salvation.

(9 minutes)

In today’s glimpse, we learn the importance of studying the lives of the saints. They spell out what Christ means and how he’s to be imitated in each vocation of life. The saints show us how everything fits together.

(15 minutes)

Mother speaks about the call to holiness in Luke 24:13-16. While walking and talking with Jesus, two disciples did not recognize Him due to their lack of belief in his full mission to suffer to enter into true glory.

(30 minutes)

This International Mass brings pilgrims from around the world together to celebrate the Feast of the Assumption at the Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes in Lourdes, France.

(120 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

Our view of eternal destiny can be very different from God’s, and the teaching office of the Church serves to put us on the right path. Because it limits us from making the wrong choices, it actually liberates us in many ways.

(15 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

Analysis on the Harris-Walz pro-abortion agenda by The Washington Examiner’s Gabrielle Etzel. Pro-life leader Kristan Hawkins shares her organization’s push at the ballot box to protect the unborn. As we celebrate the 43rd anniversary of EWTN, we take a look back at the pro-life advocacy of our foundress, Mother Angelica. @UnvarnishedGME @KristanHawkins @MontseEWTN #HarrisWalz #RaceForTheWhiteHouse #KamalaHarris #TimWalz #KristanHawkins #StudentsForLifeOfAmerica #MotherAngelica #EWTN

(30 minutes)

Acting as Mediatrix in times of confusion, strife, difficulty or disaster is one of the Blessed Mother’s most significant roles. Dr. Mark Miravalle reveals how she offers us the grace of God and her motherly beatitude.

(30 minutes)

Why do cloistered nuns and monks give up their worldly possessions to devote themselves 24/7 to God? Because the first duty of all people is communion with God, and he deserves to have people give him full-time attention.

(15 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

Personal change can happen but it takes more than determination. To experience significant lasting change, we must cooperate with grace. Thankfully, God is always there to help us.

(30 minutes)

Too many fear death without understanding it’s a gateway to eternal life. Ralph and Peter talk about the necessity of considering our death and preparing well to meet the Lord.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Sorrowful Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(19 minutes)

Explore the mystery of the Incarnation as the foundation of the Way of Beauty, which invites us to encounter God and experience His love for us in marvelous and mysterious ways.

(30 minutes)

Mother quotes St. John’s Gospel, “You did not choose Me, I chose you.” She develops this theme to mean that all of us are called to be missionaries to those around us. It is not just for those who go into the mission fields.

(30 minutes)

Our lesson explores the difficult and painful words Amos delivered to the people of Israel, telling them not to worship because they have” turned justice into wormwood and cast righteousness down to the ground.”

(30 minutes)

Our series on teen leadership concludes with the final step of the COPEC method, a unique teaching tool designed to help teens become the leaders God intends for them to be. See what happens when the process succeeds.

(30 minutes)

The children learn that suffering has a value and meaning for our lives if we offer it to God with love. With a buzz about the Sharks, Manuel disobeys his mother and is punished for it, and Henry is admitted to the hospital because of hepatitis.

(30 minutes)

Destined for a political career, St. Ambrose of Milan instead made serving God his life’s mission. As one of our greatest bishops, he defended the authentic teachings of the Church and opened up Scripture to the masses.

(30 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

EWTN’s weekly one-hour discussion of current events in the Church, politics, and culture, from a Catholic perspective. Covering the underreported stories and clarifying the Church's position on key teachings, with a focus on the laity's needs and concerns. Hosted by Catherine Hadro.

(60 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

As the pilgrims explore the inspiring destinations at Lourdes, a visit to the baths and the healing waters of the Grotto, we witness first hand the power of God's Love through the volunteers and those they care for.

(30 minutes)

Our series on teen leadership concludes with the final step of the COPEC method, a unique teaching tool designed to help teens become the leaders God intends for them to be. See what happens when the process succeeds.

(30 minutes)

EWTN’s weekly one-hour discussion of current events in the Church, politics, and culture, from a Catholic perspective. Covering the underreported stories and clarifying the Church's position on key teachings, with a focus on the laity's needs and concerns. Hosted by Catherine Hadro.

(60 minutes)

Anchored by Tracy Sabol, EWTN News Nightly is our daily news and analysis program presenting breaking Catholic News worldwide, top stories, and daily reports from the White House, Capitol Hill, and Rome. Weekdays at 6 & 9 PM EST.

(30 minutes)

The life of St. Peter is the backdrop for this exploration of the rich history and beauty of Vatican City. Fr. Leo provides a closer look at the Holy See and our first pope, the saint upon which Jesus built his Church.

(30 minutes)

Mother speaks about the call to holiness in Luke 24:13-16. While walking and talking with Jesus, two disciples did not recognize Him due to their lack of belief in his full mission to suffer to enter into true glory.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Joyful Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(20 minutes)

Diagnosed with ALS, the outloook for Christine Marro was bleak. But a visit to Lourdes during the 150th anniversary of Our Lady’s first appearance changed Chrissy’s life. Hear the true story of her miraculous healing.

(30 minutes)

Some people are called to be an instrument of God among His people. Learn about the sacrament of Holy Orders, and the important role priests play in the Church, for those who are sick or coming to the end of their life.

(15 minutes)

Peter and Paul are excited, but nervous, to be in the finals of the reef baseball championship. Lukas reminds them that God is always with us through prayer by following the example of Saint Therese of the Child Jesus.

(15 minutes)

Lia discovers her basketball skills diminish when she doesn’t practice, and the children learn it’s the same with our faith. We must practice our faith daily and stay on top of our game so we don’t slip away from God.

(30 minutes)

Celebrate your faith as EWTN Religious Catalogue presents a unique array of religious items -- from books and paintings to rosaries and statues -- and everything in between.

(30 minutes)

Mother Assumpta Long sits down with radio personality and author Al Kresta, host of Kresta in the Afternoon. Through his own life experiences, he brings a personal touch to important issues of the Catholic Faith.

(30 minutes)

The martyrdom of Alojzija Grozde, a young Slovenian student and member of Catholic Action who was killed after Yugoslav Partisans discovered him carrying religious books during World War II.

(40 minutes)

A brief introduction to Blessed Pier Giorgio Frassati: a young, joyful man, whose devotion and charity towards the poor caused Pope Francis to encourage young people to look up to him as an example of holiness.

(20 minutes)

Dr. Anders answers questions about how the Church reaches out to Catholic singles, confronting evil forces in spiritual warfare and the necessity of baptism for salvation.

(60 minutes)

Fr. Charles Connor shows how the second and third commandments instruct us to revere the mystery of God’s presence in both His name, and within the Eucharist.

(30 minutes)

Dr. Hahn and Mike discuss how to help non-Catholics understand Catholic devotion to Mary is not goddess worship, but honoring her as God's most exalted creature because of the grace of Her Son.

(30 minutes)

Michael O'Neill investigates the supernatural experiences of Benedicta Rencurel. In 1664, the Virgin Mary gave her messages about prayer for the conversion of sinners, and visited her throughout the rest of her life.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Wade Menezes wraps up the parish mission from St. Patrick’s Catholic Church concluding his talk on the universal call to holiness, which is how God calls us to divine intimacy.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate Mass from the Our Lady of Angels Chapel in Irondale, AL. (LIVE DAILY at 8 am Eastern)

(60 minutes)

This EWTN original docu-drama presents the life and ministry of Servant of God Fr. Vincent R. Capodanno, a US Navy Chaplain who was killed on September 4, 1967 who gave his life trying to minister to a fallen soldier during the Vietnam War.

(90 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Poor Clares of Perpetual Adoration recite the Joyful Mysteries of the Rosary from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(30 minutes)

Meet Joe Ross, a successful businessman who applies Catholic ethics to his job as a high school president. High school teens talk about the pressure of after school activities. And Dr. Ray gives advice on mental illness.

(60 minutes)

Fr. John Trigilio and Fr. Ken Brighenti answer viewer emails about the Petrine Privilege, a godparent’s role, committing sacrilege and still attaining heaven, whether heaven is a real place or a state of mind, and more.

(30 minutes)

In his new book, Dr. John Sottosanti explores his life as an oral surgeon finding faith, happiness and inner peace in God while surrounded by friends and patients who are atheists.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate Mass from the Our Lady of Angels Chapel in Irondale, AL. (LIVE DAILY at 8 am Eastern)

(60 minutes)

Fr. Spitzer and Doug discuss how in order to continue our personal conversion, we must recognize that God does not stand aloof but is personally and actively involved in our lives.

(60 minutes)

The martyrdom of Alojzija Grozde, a young Slovenian student and member of Catholic Action who was killed after Yugoslav Partisans discovered him carrying religious books during World War II.

(40 minutes)

A brief introduction to Blessed Pier Giorgio Frassati: a young, joyful man, whose devotion and charity towards the poor caused Pope Francis to encourage young people to look up to him as an example of holiness.

(20 minutes)

Fr. Mitch and Dr. Jeremy Gatdula discuss natural law. Its basis for democratic constitutions, why many legal scholars deny or ignore its principles and the effects of doing so.

(60 minutes)

From the First Joyful Mystery of the rosary, the Creator of heaven and earth, the author of all visible and invisible things, of all living beings on Earth, one day came to dwell in the womb of a young Jewish woman.

(30 minutes)

During Pol Pot’s regime, just under 2 million Cambodians were murdered, starved or died through illness, and the Catholic Church was practically annihilated. Today, missionary priests and nuns are engineering a rebirth.

(30 minutes)

Their pilgrimage has led them down a road to self-discovery and healing that none could have expected. Now, Fr. Angelus and the children bring home the lessons they learned that helped them all grow closer to God.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Glorious Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(18 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word as they recite a litany in honor of the Most Blessed Sacrament from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(12 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama, as they pray the Litany of the Sacred Heart.

(10 minutes)

Biblical hope is the assurance that God’s blessings and good experiences lie in our future. Hope inspires us, energizes us and invigorates us to live differently. It lasts forever.

(30 minutes)

Dr. Robert Haddad discusses the importance of being willing and ready to share the faith with young people, and how we can meet the current challenges like atheism and the ‘nones’.

(30 minutes)

Analysis on the Harris-Walz pro-abortion agenda by The Washington Examiner’s Gabrielle Etzel. Pro-life leader Kristan Hawkins shares her organization’s push at the ballot box to protect the unborn. As we celebrate the 43rd anniversary of EWTN, we take a look back at the pro-life advocacy of our foundress, Mother Angelica. @UnvarnishedGME @KristanHawkins @MontseEWTN #HarrisWalz #RaceForTheWhiteHouse #KamalaHarris #TimWalz #KristanHawkins #StudentsForLifeOfAmerica #MotherAngelica #EWTN

(30 minutes)

EWTN’s weekly one-hour discussion of current events in the Church, politics, and culture, from a Catholic perspective. Covering the underreported stories and clarifying the Church's position on key teachings, with a focus on the laity's needs and concerns. Hosted by Catherine Hadro.

(60 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama, as they pray the Litany of the Sacred Heart.

(10 minutes)

Experience Giuseppe Verdi’s powerful and iconic Requiem in D Minor in a performance at Milan’s Church of San Marco. Teodor Currentzis conducts this historic concert at the same place it premiered in 1868.

(90 minutes)

Explore the history of the world’s oldest and smallest military force protecting the Pope for centuries, and meet new recruits as they undergo rigorous training.

(30 minutes)

San Giovanni Rotondo is one of our most popular pilgrimage destinations. On his Italian journey, Fr. Leo Patalinghug reflects on God’s goodness in a city known for its great food and the miraculous life of St. Padre Pio.

(30 minutes)

The journey begins for five college students seeking to find God's voice and to take a break from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

(30 minutes)

Works covered by Joseph Pearce are “The Waste Land,” a poem by T.S. Eliot, “Kristin Lavransdatter,” a trilogy written by Sigrid Undset, and “C,” a novel by Maurice Baring.

(30 minutes)

St. Dominic and Beauvoir battle over what it means to be man and woman. But an attempt to burn each other’s books becomes a test of right and wrong, and the Church must follow Christ to the fullest to preach the Gospel.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama, as they pray the Litany of the Sacred Heart.

(10 minutes)

After serving as evangelical missionaries in Africa, Richard and Danelle realized what was missing in their lives – the history, beauty and spirituality of the Catholic Church.

(30 minutes)

Courtney Mares is back with Brother John to discuss her new book about Blessed Carlo Acuti and also delve into Carlo’s great devotion to the Holy Eucharist.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Poor Clares of Perpetual Adoration recite the Glorious Mysteries of the Rosary from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(30 minutes)

Dr. Kreeft and Dr. Howard examine what it means to be truly free, and how the rules of the moral order serve as guidelines that lead to true happiness.

(30 minutes)

When her youngest son Brian was taken by force from off-campus housing and killed, Rachel Mura found the courage to publicly forgive the killers even before his body was found.

(30 minutes)

The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word celebrate the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass each Sunday from Our Lady of the Angels Chapel as friars intone Gregorian chant. Visiting clergy concelebrate this sacrament. LIVE Sundays at 8 am Eastern.

(80 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word at the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama, as they pray the Litany of the Sacred Heart.

(10 minutes)

This EWTN original docu-drama presents the life and ministry of Servant of God Fr. Vincent R. Capodanno, a US Navy Chaplain who was killed on September 4, 1967 who gave his life trying to minister to a fallen soldier during the Vietnam War.

(90 minutes)

Celebrate your faith as EWTN Religious Catalogue presents a unique array of religious items -- from books and paintings to rosaries and statues -- and everything in between.

(30 minutes)

New Orleans native Earl Jones faced a fight for his life during one of the deadliest hurricanes in history. A desperate call out in faith from the midst of the storm led to surprising help from a heavenly friend.

(30 minutes)

In the 4th to 6th centuries, proponents of Donatism argued the clergy must be sinless in order for the sacraments to be valid. See how the Church responded to this threat, and where the echoes of this heresy exist today.

(30 minutes)

Dr. Robert Haddad discusses the importance of being willing and ready to share the faith with young people, and how we can meet the current challenges like atheism and the ‘nones’.

(30 minutes)

Everyone can be a co-worker in God's plan of salvation. Learn some valuable tips on how one can become an instrument to help Him rescue the many souls one comes in contact with everyday.

(30 minutes)

Church Historian, Fr. Charles Connor, examines the life and work of two great Doctors of the Church: St. Anthony of Padua- the Evangelical Doctor, and St. Lawrence of Brindisi-Doctor of Conversions.

(30 minutes)

Works covered by Joseph Pearce are “The Waste Land,” a poem by T.S. Eliot, “Kristin Lavransdatter,” a trilogy written by Sigrid Undset, and “C,” a novel by Maurice Baring.

(30 minutes)

Mother Angelica and the Nuns of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery ask for the intercession of the Prince of the Heavenly Hosts and the nine Choirs of Angels, as they pray the chaplet of St. Michael.

(30 minutes)

Fr. Mitch Pacwa leads the Joyful Mysteries of the Rosary from the actual holy sites and shrines where they took place, bringing the Gospels to life and offering a deeper understanding of the Rosary meditations.

(20 minutes)

Join the Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word as they recite this beautiful prayer in honor of the Blessed Virgin Mary from the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Hanceville, Alabama.

(10 minutes)
